text:
I'm trying to add a character in between all my values of a specific column.  I've tried the following but it's not being applied to my data frame. It's just outputting an example of the desired result.

```dot = "."
for name in df.Name 
  return name[1:3] * "$(dot)" * name[4:end]
end```
 This is the output I'm getting:
```"520.00"```
This is exactly the format I'd like but applied to all values of the column

elements.text: I'm trying to add a character in between all my values of a specific column.  I've tried the following but it's not being applied to my data frame. It's just outputting an example of the desired result.

dot = "."
for name in df.Name 
  return name[1:3] * "$(dot)" * name[4:end]
end
This is the output I'm getting:
This is exactly the format I'd like but applied to all values of the column

text:
This is one of those "tutorials will help" questions. You want `map`

```df.newname = map(df.nam) do name
    return name[1:3] * "$(dot)" * name[4:end]
end```

elements.text: This is one of those "tutorials will help" questions. You want
map

df.newname = map(df.nam) do name
    return name[1:3] * "$(dot)" * name[4:end]
end

text:
You are returning the value so it just exits the loop. I'm not sure if ti works but something like this might work
```dot = "."
for name in df.Name 
  name =  name[1:3] * "$(dot)" * name[4:end]
end```

elements.text: You are returning the value so it just exits the loop. I'm not sure if ti works but something like this might work

dot = "."
for name in df.Name 
  name =  name[1:3] * "$(dot)" * name[4:end]
end

text: That will not work. that just re-binds the local variable name.

elements.text: That will not work. that just re-binds the local variable name.

text: Ok thanks. I've done some tutorials but I haven't learned about map yet

elements.text: Ok thanks. I've done some tutorials but I haven't learned about map yet

text:
Also, the `transform` way of doing this is also easy

```transform(df, :name => ByRow(n -> n[1:3] * dot * n[4:end]) => :name)```

elements.text: Also, the
transform
way of doing this is also easy
transform(df, :name => ByRow(n -> n[1:3] * dot * n[4:end]) => :name)

text: Thanks transform seems easier to understand at this point.
